turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lunge mine.
turn.1: What is the main problem of the Lunge mine?
turn.2: This would set off the mine, blowing up its user and, probably, the targeted enemy armour.
turn.3: What is the effectiveness of the mine?
turn.4: The mine was capable of penetrating about 152.4 mm of RHA at an angle of 90º, and up to 101.6 mm at an angle of 60º.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: However, the mine would almost always impact at 90º because the impact angle with the objective would be decided by the weapon's user, and he would probably aim for a 90º armour plate.
turn.8: The weapon was used by the Imperial Japanese Army during the later stages of the Second World War in the Pacific Theater against American armour, until the end of the war in 1945, the same year that the weapon was introduced into service.
turn.9: Was the mine used in other wars?
turn.10: In Vietnam it is considered an icon of the First Indochina War, specifically during the Battle of Hanoi.
turn.11: Was the mine used against US forces?
turn.12: There are also some records of this weapon being used by the North Vietnamese soldiers during the Vietnam War, where it was also used against American armoured vehicles.
